action.action-desc: Mrs. Noem (for herself and Mr. Zinke) introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Ways and Means

form.official-title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide an exception to the employer health insurance mandate for Indian tribal governments and tribally owned businesses.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Tribal Employment and Jobs Protection Act.

section.header: Exception to employer health insurance mandate for Indian tribal governments and tribally owned businesses

subsection.text: Section 4980H(c)(2) of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 is amended by adding at the end the following new subparagraph:

subparagraph.header: Exception for Indian tribal governments and tribally owned businesses

clause.text: The term applicable large employer shall not include any tribal employer.
For purposes of this subparagraph, the term tribal employer meansâ€”

subclause.text: any Indian tribal government (as defined in section 7701(a)(40)) or subdivision thereof, or any agency or instrumentality of either,
any tribal organization (as defined in section 4(l) of the Indian Self-Determination and Education Assistance Act (25 U.S.C. 450b(l))),

any corporation if more than 50 percent (determined by vote and value) of the outstanding stock of such corporation is owned, directly or indirectly, by any entity described in subclause (I) or (II), and
any partnership if more than 50 percent of the value of the capital and profits interests are owned, directly or indirectly, by any entity described in subclause (I) or (II).

subsection.text: The amendment made by this section shall apply to months beginning after December 31, 2014.
